isis.stitle: AIR COMPRESSOR: MIDLAND MODELS EL-1300 AND EL-1600 - ASSEMBLE - PISTONS AND CONNECTING RODS

step1.para: Position connecting rod in piston, then press piston pin in place. Install snap rings in piston at both ends of piston pin ( Figure 15).
Install two compression rings in each of the two grooves and two oil rails and expander in bottom groove ( Figure 15).

note.para: Compression rings must be installed with surface marked "TOP" facing top of piston. Some compression rings may have dots to indicate top of ring.
Stagger ring gaps by 120 degrees. DO NOT have ring gaps in line with another ring gap.

step1.para: Position connecting rod bearing inserts in rod and bearing cap, making sure that the locating lips on inserts engage the locking notches in rod and cap. Insure that arrows on caps and rod match as shown in Figure 16. Also, make sure that the rod cap being installed is on rod from which it was removed.
Be sure rings are staggered in each ring groove by about 120 degrees. Apply engine oil to the rings and piston. Use a ring compressor and compress piston rings.
Turn crankshaft until crank journal on the piston being installed is at the bottom of the stroke.
Lubricate both halves of the rod bearing being installed with engine oil.
Place piston/rod assembly into cylinder bore with arrow on rod facing toward the outside of the crankcase.
Be sure that the ring compressor is flush with the block. Use a hammer handle and tap piston into cylinder until top of piston is flush or past the top of the block.

Turn compressor assembly over and position connecting rod on crankshaft journal making sure that the inserts are in place. Install caps and inserts matching arrows on bearing cap and rod as shown in Figure 16and Figure 17.

figure.caption: Figure 17. Connecting Rod on Crankshaft - Inserts Are In Place

step1.para: Tighten connecting rod bolts using a 12 point 5/16 in. socket to 185 - 225 in-lbs. (20.9 - 25.4 N•m).
Install the second piston/rod assembly in the same manner.
